channel.title: HTML to PHP (solved)
channel.description: The title isnt really exactly what I need. I have gotten the MC launcher to work as an applet (finally) after minor editing etc (as in, re-doing its manifest and signing). Now, to get this to work properly as intended (since a login form isnt possible [b]yet[/b]), to get this to work, as if I navigated to: "http://yoursite.com/index.php?user=coonhunter" and it print out code like: [code=html] <html> <body> <center> <head> <style> body { background-image: url("dirt.png") } </style> </head> <applet code="net.minecraft.Launcher" archive="./mc.jar" width="854" height="480"> <param name="separate_jvm" value="true"> <param name="java_arguments" value="-Dsun.java2d.noddraw=true -Dsun.awt.noerasebackground=true -Dsun.java2d.d3d=false -Dsun.java2d.opengl=false -Dsun.java2d.pmoffscreen=false -Xms512M -Xmx512M"> <param name="userName" value="CooonHunter"> <param name="latestVersion" value="1303302694000"> <param name="downloadTicket" value="1d1d3888da375267c377de82a5e8ff99"> <param name="sessionId" value="2095002344773593704"> </applet> </center> </body> </html> [/code]

item.title: HTML to PHP (solved)
item.dc:creator: @_s11 s1gma
item.description:
@_s11 wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:11, topic:393170”][quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=490340.msg3585556#msg3585556 date=1304142378]
Anyways, around what size would you suggest? I’m on a 1920/1080 monitor, so large to me is 1500x800 lmfao.
[/quote]
Do it by the percentage… then you don’t have to worry about anyone having an abnormally large or small applet. I normally use a tiny 1024x600 monitor display which doesn’t like stuff at normal resolutions.[/quote]

midget.

Read full topic

item.title: HTML to PHP (solved)
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

CoonHunter:

Anyways, around what size would you suggest? I’m on a 1920/1080 monitor, so large to me is 1500x800 lmfao.

Do it by the percentage… then you don’t have to worry about anyone having an abnormally large or small applet. I normally use a tiny 1024x600 monitor display which doesn’t like stuff at normal resolutions.

Read full topic

item.title: HTML to PHP (solved)
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“Muroth, post:4, topic:393170”]You still need to add quotes to the param userName, else it won’t work. I used your index file on /mc-web/, and I did view-source to make sure it worked correctly. Which, the parameter was missing quotes…

So yeah :P. Fix that and you’re set.[/quote]
Eeh, it was actually a ’ on the end of line 2 creating an error, other than that, it works 100% now. Any idea’s on a size I should make it?

Read full topic

item.title: HTML to PHP (solved)
item.dc:creator: @Muroth Muroth
item.description:
@Muroth wrote:

You still need to add quotes to the param userName, else it won’t work. I used your index file on /mc-web/, and I did view-source to make sure it worked correctly. Which, the parameter was missing quotes…

So yeah :P. Fix that and you’re set.

Read full topic

item.title: HTML to PHP (solved)
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Thanks muroth, that worked nealry perfectly. Had to edit the param a tad bit to get it to stick how it should.

Link if you want to test:
http://cuddlepups.net/mc-web/?user=USERNAME

Read full topic

item.description:
@Muroth wrote:

[code]<?php
$user = $_GET[‘user’]’;
?>

body { background-image: url("dirt.png") } [/code] Using PHP to get the username is what you're asking for?

item.title: HTML to PHP (solved)
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

The title isnt really exactly what I need. I have gotten the MC launcher to work as an applet (finally) after minor editing etc (as in, re-doing its manifest and signing). Now, to get this to work properly as intended (since a login form isnt possible yet), to get this to work, as if I navigated to: “http://yoursite.com/index.php?user=coonhunter” and it print out code like:

<html>
 <body>
  <center>
   <head>
    <style>
     body {
            background-image: url("dirt.png")
        }
    </style>
   </head>
    <applet code="net.minecraft.Launcher" archive="./mc.jar" width="854" height="480">
    <param name="separate_jvm" value="true">    
    <param name="java_arguments" value="-Dsun.java2d.noddraw=true -Dsun.awt.noerasebackground=true -Dsun.java2d.d3d=false -Dsun.java2d.opengl=false -Dsun.java2d.pmoffscreen=false -Xms512M -Xmx512M">
    <param name="userName" value="CooonHunter">    
    <param name="latestVersion" value="1303302694000">    
    <param name="downloadTicket" value="1d1d3888da375267c377de82a5e8ff99">
    <param name="sessionId" value="2095002344773593704">
   </applet>
  </center>
 </body>
</html>

Read full topic
